descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value:
Chicago, Journalism and Social Change

From Ida B. Wells' campaign against lynching to the acclaimed documentary "The Interrupters," which examines gang violence, Chicago has long fostered journalism that tackles- and attempts to influence - the nation's most compelling and complex issues. In this course, students will analyze crucial moments in social-issues journalism in one of the world's great cities. At the same time, through a partnership with Medill's Social Justice News Nexus, students will produce reporting involving a current cluster of topics critical to Chicago: segregation, inequality and housing.
